item.title: Hard Rock Hotel moves into Madrid
item.dc:creator: Brian Kirsten
item.content:encoded: From the NYTimes Travel Section (Subscribe to NYTimes - Travel): The new Hard Rock Hotel is causing a stir in the centuries-old neighborhood where it will soon open. "Few old Madrid neighborhoods are left, and now this one has become fashionable," she said, entering her 1880 apartment building with its wrought-iron balconies. "The small-town feel has disappeared. It is on its way to becoming a place for tourism, drinks and wild times." The first leggy model has yet to check in, but the Hard Rock Hotel has already become a symbol of the upscale transformation. After an inaugural night of celebrity sighting (the manager won't drop names, yet), it will become the fifth design-conscious hotel to open in the small Letras neighborhood the last two years.
